title: Providing for the Closing of Executive Departments and Agencies of the Federal Government on December 24, 2024

enrichment.summary: This executive order mandates that all federal executive departments and agencies close and excuse employees from duty on December 24, 2024, the day before Christmas. However, department heads may require certain employees to work on that day for national security or public needs, and pay and leave rules will apply as specified. The Director of the Office of Personnel Management is responsible for implementing the order.
potential_concerns: The closure may increase payroll costs for the federal government due to paid leave without work, impacting the federal budget.
Essential services could be disrupted if agencies do not carefully manage which employees must remain on duty.
Some employees required to work on December 24 may face increased workload and stress during a holiday period.
Implementation challenges may arise in ensuring consistent application across diverse agencies and roles.
